required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Edoxaban Treatment Versus Vitamin K Antagonist in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation Undergoing Percutaneous Coronary Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of an Edoxaban-based Compared to a Vitamin K Antagonist-based Antithrombotic Regimen in Subjects With Atrial Fibrillation Following Successful Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) With Stent Placement.

brief_summary.textblock: There are insufficient data on the safety and efficacy of edoxaban plus antiplatelet therapy in subjects with atrial fibrillation AF following percutaneous intervention PCI with stenting. This study is designed to evaluate the safety and to explore the efficacy of an edoxaban-based antithrombotic regimen versus a vitamin K antagonist VKA-based antithrombotic regimen in subjects with AF following PCI with stent placement. Bleeding is a central safety outcome in cardiovascular clinical trials, especially for antithrombotic strategies and invasive procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Major or Clinically Relevant Non-major Bleeding defined by International Society on Thrombosis and Haemostasis (ISTH)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Composite of cardiovascular (CV) death, stroke, systemic embolic events (SEE), myocardial infarction (MI) and definite stent thrombosis
Number of participants with Major Bleeding defined by ISTH
Number of participants with Net Clinical Benefit (NCB)
secondary_outcome.description: Net Clinical Benefit (NCB) is defined as the composite of CV death, stroke, SEE, MI, definite stent thrombosis along with ISTH-defined major bleeding

arm_group.description: Edoxaban 60 mg once-daily or 30 mg once-daily in selected subjects
Clopidogrel 75 mg once-daily (or in the presence of a documented clinical need prasugrel [5mg or 10 mg once-daily] or ticagrelor [90 mg twice-daily] may be used).

intervention.description: Edoxaban 60 mg once-daily or 30 mg once-daily in selected subjects

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data (IPD) and applicable supporting clinical trial documents may be available upon request at https://www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com//. In cases where clinical trial data and supporting documents are provided pursuant to our company policies and procedures, Daiichi Sankyo will continue to protect the privacy of our clinical trial participants. Details on data sharing criteria and the procedure for requesting access can be found at this web address: https://www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com/Study-Sponsors/Study-Sponsors-DS.aspx
